newsitem.title: USA: Ariz. 720 MW coal unit maintenance set for Nov 9.
newsitem.headline: Ariz. 720 MW coal unit maintenance set for Nov 9.

text.p: The 720 megwatt (MW) unit 1 at the Salt River Project's Navajo coal-fired power plant near Page, Ariz., will shut for regular maintenance on Nov. 9, the public utility said Wednesday.
The outage is scheduled to end Dec 18.
Navajo's other two 720 MW units are continuing to operate at normal rates, the SRP source said.
The Salt River Project, a state government agency, operates the plant and owns a 27 percent interest. The other owners are the U.S. Bureau of Reclamation and various public power companies.
